item.title: ESL Business News: April 09, 2007
item.itunes:author: Bob DuCharme
item.itunes:subtitle: A summary of international business news for the week ending April 09, 2007
item.itunes:summary: US and South Korea sign a free trade agreement; US and Mexican phone companies try to buy an Italian one; Germany's E.ON gives up on buying Spanish utility Endesa; Kirk Kerkorian wants to buy Chrysler; Apple offering EMI music without copy protection. Podcast script at http://www.eslbusinessnews.com/scripts/20070409.html.
item.description: US and South Korea sign a free trade agreement; US and Mexican phone companies try to buy an Italian one; Germany's E.ON gives up on buying Spanish utility Endesa; Kirk Kerkorian wants to buy Chrysler; Apple offering EMI music without copy protection.

item.title: ESL Business News: April 16, 2007
item.itunes:author: Bob DuCharme
item.itunes:subtitle: A summary of international business news for the week ending April 16, 2007
item.itunes:summary: Japan and China friendlier; US and China less friendly; World Bank president Paul Wolfowitz in trouble; Nestle buys baby food company; Google buys online ad firm. Podcast script at http://www.eslbusinessnews.com/scripts/20070416.html.
item.description: Japan and China friendlier; US and China less friendly; World Bank president Paul Wolfowitz in trouble; Nestle buys baby food company; Google buys online ad firm.

item.title: ESL Business News: April 23, 2007
item.itunes:author: Bob DuCharme
item.itunes:subtitle: A summary of international business news for the week ending April 23, 2007
item.itunes:summary: British pound costs 2 US dollars; Ch치vez and Lula disagree over ethanol; big Blackberry service disruption; Sallie Mae sells themselves; problems at Yahoo. Podcast script at http://www.eslbusinessnews.com/scripts/20070423.html.

item.title: ESL Business News: April 30, 2007
item.itunes:author: Bob DuCharme
item.itunes:subtitle: A summary of international business news for the week ending April 30, 2007
item.itunes:summary: British banks compete for ABN AMRO; Toyota becomes world's biggest auto seller; AstraZeneca wants MedImmune; Siemens in bigger trouble; Cadbury prosecuted for selling poisoned chocolate. Podcast script at http://www.eslbusinessnews.com/scripts/20070430.html.
item.description: British banks compete for ABN AMRO; Toyota becomes world's biggest auto seller; AstraZeneca wants MedImmune; Siemens in bigger trouble; Cadbury prosecuted for selling poisoned chocolate.

item.title: ESL Business News: May 07, 2007
item.itunes:author: Bob DuCharme
item.itunes:subtitle: A summary of international business news for the week ending May 07, 2007
item.itunes:summary: Hugo Ch치vez nationalizes more oil fields for May Day; Chinese make pet food poisoning arrest; Rupert Murdoch wants the Wall St. Journal; Thomson Corporation wants Reuters; US Supreme Court makes influential patent decision. Podcast script at http://www.eslbusinessnews.com/scripts/20070507.html.
